page.title: 01 THE KNOLL
page.content: {The Knoll}is the highest place in our area. It dates back to the{Ice Age} when a{glacier}melted and left everything that it had pushed in front of it in the shape of a hill. The word Knoll means a small rounded hill or mound. On the day we climbed it the weather was dull and overcast but you could still see all of our area for the{Domesday Project.}It was very windy,just the place to fly a kite,and we were puffed out when we got to the top. From the top you could see through{360 degrees.}The main sight were lots of fields, some were being silaged by the farmers and later some will be used for hay. There were only a few sheep and cows that we could see that day. We could see the road running through the middle of our area, the road goes from{Leominster}to {Ludlow.}
